Whenever you X out one of the circles in a chain, then you automatically cross out the other circle in the chain — even if that color has been marked to the right of the circle or is finished. Now you have second chances to fill in spaces that might otherwise lie empty!

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Early Launch Kit
Description:
5x Copies of Robinson Crusoe
1x Demo Copy of Robinson Crusoe
2x new Scenario "Poachers"
8x Fifth Character "Sailor"
8x Spyglass
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Kingsfall
Description:
Kingsfall is a true 4X campaign style board game with a heavy focus on expansion, resource management, and strategic gameplay. The game was designed for players of all skill and play types as it aims to be streamlined and straight forward. There are no excess mechanics and rules that other 4X style games seem to have, and this allows players to focus on having fun rather than reading rulebooks.

Players each take control of a Guild, and must make their Guild the dominant Guild in the region by whichever means the player chooses. Each Guild has minor perks that may aid a specific play style, but all of the Guilds are on a level playing field. No one Guild is stronger than any others, so choosing your Guild can be a simple as picking your favorite color or name.

Players take turns each moving their pieces around the board, building structures and collecting resources along the way. Heavily dependant on resource management, resources can be used to build more structures and units to increase a player's presence on the map and expand their borders even further. Players must be sure not to grow too quickly however, as in traditional 4X style, everything must be  taken care of. People must be fed and paid, and cities must be maintained. Grow too quickly and you won't be able to sustain your empire, grow too slowly and other players will surely beat you to the finish.

With no guidelines restricting player interaction, each of the players is highly encouraged to interact with one another through diplomatic talks. Alliances, war, declaration of friendships, trade, treaties, shunning, the list goes on. Players must bear in mind however the repercussions of their choices and how they may affect other players. With multiple paths to victory, Kingsfall caters to many different play styles. It is entirely possible to win without ever going to war, and it is also possible to win by only going to war. Ultimately the path to victory is up to the player.

Read the back story here

Name: Herbaceous Sprouts: Green Thumb Mini Expansion
Description:
"To grow a more challenging game, add in these green Thumb Cards!"

A set of 4 cards provided with the Kickstarter of Herbaceous Sprouts. They are separate from the base game.

To use the expansion, randomly remove 3 Tool Cards from the main game deck without revealing them and replace them with 3 of the 4 Green Thumb Cards and shuffle, again without revealing them.

Each card grants VPs, which are saved until scoring at the end of the game.

Name: Western Legends: Wild Bunch of Extras
Description:
Black smoke rises as the locomotive draws near. Out there on the cloudless horizon, a town called Buzzard Gulch is calling to those with the will and the grit to make a name for themselves in the new western frontier.

The Wild Bunch of Extras expansion includes all the unlocked stretch goal content unlocked during the 2019 Kickstarter for Western Legends: Ante Up. Complete with new variants, characters, deluxe components, and an expanded card pool to add even more options and variety to your games!

Name: PitBulls
Description:
Stock exchange simulation game, where the TRADERS watch a 10-round, 8-way contest (among 8 COLORS) and BET/TRADE on the winner of that contest.

The themes are negotiation, probability estimation, and trend-spotting.  The goal is to finish with more money than you start with, and even better — finishing with the most money.  The mechanism of negotiation is "open outcry" — there are no "turns"; it's everyone's turn at all times to make any deal they can with anyone who is willing to listen to their price(s).

All TRADERS start with a portfolio of 4 shares of each COLOR, plus $400 in cash.  As the contest proceeds through 10 rounds, a TRADER use his/her cash to buy COLORS from other TRADERS, and the TRADER will sell shares of his COLORs to raise cash.

The game ends when the 10-round contest is over.  At that time the shares of the winning COLOR are worth $100, and the shares of all other COLORs are worth zero.  Each TRADER finishes with a total value of his/her portfolio: CASH + SHARES FINISHING "in the money".

PitBulls can be customized to trade on ANY multi-way (up to 8 player/outcome) event or contest. Plus, it's expandable (with more colored (or textured) cards) to trade on ANY event (like the NCAA tournament, presidential election, best performing IPO for the month). If played on a concurrent game of Monopoly, for example, PitBulls becomes a meta game; a session of PitBulls lasts as long as the contest/event on whose outcome you are trading.

—description from designer

Name: Planet-Spelet
Description:
This interesting Swedish space game is a spin and move game that has players travel though the solar system to distant planets where they collect radioactive elements or platinum.
Players start with a spacecraft from Earth and head out into outer space. Mars, Jupiter and the other planets revolve in a 24 spaced orbit around the sun. Movement of planets and rockets are directed by a large disc in the center of the board that is spun by the players. The players rockets move to different orbits and planets by landing on a Cosmic Radiation cardboard strip that also rotates around he board (covering only one space across all orbits). 
Many hazards and difficulties are against the spaceships. Meteor showers, radioactive dust clouds, operating errors, space police, and much more.
The object of the game is to bring home these riches to earth. The player, who first manages to return their spacecraft back to Earth with a full load  of radioactive material or platinum is the winner.

—user summmary

Name: Quiz Match
Description:
Quiz Match is a trivia game where two teams try to answer ten questions.

After each attempt, the panel is flipped and each team tells the other how many good answers they have (without further information).

—user summary

Name: Destroy These Cards
Description:
Destroy These Cards is a party game where every card features a different real-life challenge. Dare your friends (or the entire group) to do increasingly ridiculous challenges tasks, while trying to keep track of the challenges you’ve already accepted.

Mayhem unfolds as players start adding their own challenges to the deck. Get rewarded for creating good cards. Vote to get rid of the...not-so-good cards.

Name: CoderMindz
Description:
From the box:

It's the year 2045. An Artificial Neural Network has been created. Bo, Mo, Po, and Jo need to be trained. Once trained they can help recognize images.

But here's the twist - in a world full of bots, you are still the Master Mind. Train the bots with the Code Cards and help them infer the images. Pick one of the 4 set of images: robo-animals, neural dataset digits, robo-edibles, and robo-vehicles. There are 6 levels that teach Artificial Intelligence concepts on top of coding concepts.

The idea is easy - play a board game, train bots with code, and learn AI - all in a fun and exciting Neural Adventure!

...

CoderMindz is a card-based programming game for ages 6 and up. The goal is to use the cards you draw each turn to move your Bot across the grid on the board to get from your Start to your End.  The cards use various types of coding commands, starting with Move and Zap, and building on that with Conditionals, Loops, and Functions.

Six different levels of game play move you from learning the cards (basic and advanced training) to using those cards to move about the gameboard and pick up items (image recognition) and finally to programming the Bot's entire journey at once and then "running" the program to see if you're successful or need to go back to debug. Along the way, you can Zap another Bot (in your line of sight) back to their Start. The first Bot to their End spot is the winner.

Name: MechAge
Description:
First contact was a disaster. The alien ship exploded in orbit raining radioactive debris around the globe. The world slid into chaos as governments collapsed and radiation mutates animals into monsters. New city-states rushed to develop technologies from the wreckage to defend themselves.

Now the Mech, our newest weapon, is ready for your command. The dawn of the MechAge is here...

MechAge is a solo, scenario driven game, in which the player will choose two cards to create a custom mech and unique infantry squad combination. Each turn the player will attempt to complete the scenario goals by choosing 1 action for their mech and 1 action for their infantry such as move, attack, defend, repair or a variety of special actions. After the players turn, the scenario will automatically act triggering special effects, damaging the player and working towards its own goals. If the player can complete the scenario goal while keeping their mech from being destroyed they win!

-description from publisher


Players are expected to provide:

     1 Infantry Strength token
     1 Infantry Position token
     1 Mech Command token
     1 Infantry Command token
     2 Mech Strength tokens
     2 Standard Dice (d6)



Released in the March 2019 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package, together with the Attack of Varanor scenario adventure.

Name: Tang Garden: Golden Age
Description:
The Golden Age is an expansion for ThunderGryph Games' Tang Garden.

This expansion contains several of the stretch goals from the Tang Garden Kickstarter.

Golden Age contains:

16 Garden Tiles (4 each of grass, rock, water, and tao)
8 Characters, each with a card and plastic miniature

     Emissary
     Gardener
     Geomancer
     Literate
     Musician
     Nobleman
     Princess
     Tao Priest


5 Decorations, each with 2 tokens and 3 cards

     Butterfly
     Bonsai
     Duck
     Vase
     Ninfea


6 Landscapes, 3 large and 3 small
2 Lantern types, each with 4 lantern tokens
1 six-sided Scenario die
